event: trauma to face and chest wall
intramuscular and subpectoral hematoma in the right chest wall
acute right second through fifth anterior rib fractures
started on empiric antibiotics with intravenous piperacillin–tazobactam
hypotensive with blood pressure of 60/40 mmHg
admitted to the intensive care unit for suspected septic shock
antibiotics broadened to intravenous vancomycin, cefepime and metronidazole
repeat blood, urine and sputum cultures obtained
sputum cultures grew methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus
concern for infection of prosthetic knee joint
synovial fluid was cloudy, amber colored
complete washout and debridement of the joint with retention of the prosthesis
operative note described an infected knee with purulence
antibiotic regimen transitioned to intravenous cefazolin
cultures from the infected area grew C. bifermentans
antibiotic regimen transitioned to intravenous ampicillin–sulbactam
contrast computerized tomography scan of the abdomen
recovered full range of motion of his left knee
no signs of lingering joint or systemic infection
had not yet opted to undergo colonoscopy
